intro: Teucrium macrum, commonly known as purple germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from blue to purple, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its aromatic leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Teucrium macrum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
